brief: Channel number.
detailed: This value is a 0 based channel index number (0..4)

brief: Number of assigned LIN Rx- objects.
This is a pointer to a array of LIN Tx objects.
This is a pointer to a array of LIN Rx objects.
Pointer to BUS-Off notification Routine.
This holds a pointer to a wakeup callback routine.
Channel index.
Pointer to LIN driver's receive message buffer.
Protected Frame Id (= PID) of LIN frame (Take 6 Bit Id of this LIN frame from LDF and add 2 Bits CRC according to LIN 2.0 specification!)
Data length of Rx LIN frame.
Callback routine.
User supplied parameter.
detailed: This parameter will be passed to the callback routine.

brief: This points to a variable.
detailed: The driver resets (write 0 ) this variable each time this object has been received. This may be used to realize a timeout recognition.

brief: The entire hw status of the LIN channel provided by l_ifc_read_status() interface.
Error in response: set if a frame error is detected in the frame response.
Successful transfer: set if a frame has been transmitted/received without an error.
Overrun: set if two or more frames are processed since the last call to this function.

Go to sleep: set in a slave node if a go to sleep command has been received, and set 
in a Master node when the go to sleep command is successfully transmitted on the bus.
Bus inactivity in response: set if a frame error is detected in the frame response,.
Value 0.
Last frame protected identifier: the protected identifier last detected on the bus and processed in the node.
Pointer to data buffer.
Protected Frame Id (= PID) of LIN frame (Take 6 Bit Id of this LIN frame from LDF and add 2 Bits CRC according to LIN 2.0 specification!)
Channel index.
Callback routine.
User supplied parameter.
detailed: This parameter will be passed to the callback routine.

brief: Diagnostic request schedule table.
Diagnostic response schedule table.
Flashing schedule table.
Application schedule table.
Alternative schedule table.
Currently activated schedule table.
New schedule table requested to be activated.
Schedule table that was active before switching to diagnostic table.
Flag to mark if flashing schedule table is requested.
Flag to mark if alternative schedule table is requested.
Entry point in the new application schedule.
Flag to mark if the diagnostic request schedule has been sent.
Flag to mark the suppression of the communication DTC.
detailed: Flag to mark the supression of the communication DTC.

brief: Flag to mark the handling of the alternative schedule table.
Counter to be used when switching to diagnostic schedule table.
Flag for the request to switch the LIN to online mode.
Flag for the request to switch the LIN to offline mode.
Flag for the request to switch the LIN to normal mode.
Flag for the request to switch the LIN to sleep mode.
